saarland.cispa.bletrackerlib.remote

Class RemoteConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • saarland.cispa.bletrackerlib.remote.RemoteConnection

  • public class RemoteConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    Here the interaction with the rest service(s) is done. For each service you add to BleTracker sending and receiving is done based on the RemotePreferences if you specified some own or the default will be used.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteConnection

        public RemoteConnection(java.lang.String url,
                        android.content.Context context,
                        RemotePreferences remotePreferences)
        Creates a new connection to an RESTful endpoint
        Parameters:
        url - the URL
        context - the application context
        remotePreferences - the settings. This specifies how sending and receiving will behave

    • Method Detail

      • getPinnedSocketFactory

        private com.android.volley.toolbox.HurlStack getPinnedSocketFactory()
        Returns the HurlStack if a keystore has been provided or null for default
        Returns:
        a HurlStack

      • requestBeacons

        public void requestBeacons(double longitudeStart,
                           double longitudeEnd,
                           double latitudeStart,
                           double latitudeEnd)
        Request beacons in the specified range. You get the response sent to all RemoteRequestReceiver callbacks you have registered.
        Parameters:
        longitudeStart - the longitude start coordinate
        longitudeEnd - the longitude end coordinate
        latitudeStart - the latitude start coordinate
        latitudeEnd - the latitude end coordinate

      • requestBeacons

        public void requestBeacons(double longitudeStart,
                           double longitudeEnd,
                           double latitudeStart,
                           double latitudeEnd,
                           RemoteRequestReceiver receiver)
        Request beacons in the specified range You get the response sent ONLY to the RemoteRequestReceiver you have passed as argument!
        Parameters:
        longitudeStart - the longitude start coordinate
        longitudeEnd - the longitude end coordinate
        latitudeStart - the latitude start coordinate
        latitudeEnd - the latitude end coordinate
        receiver - the callback which receives the requested beacons

      • sendBeacon

        public void sendBeacon(SimpleBeacon simpleBeacon)
        Send a beacon. Be aware that this beacon only gets send if SendMode allows this.
        Parameters:
        simpleBeacon - the beacon to send

      • sendAllBeacons

        public void sendAllBeacons(java.util.List<SimpleBeacon> simpleBeacons)
        Send all beacons. Be aware that they only get send if SendMode allows this.
        Parameters:
        simpleBeacons - the beacons to send

      • addRemoteReceiver

        public void addRemoteReceiver(RemoteRequestReceiver callback)
        Adds a callback to callback list which gets fired if beacons are received.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback

      • removeRemoteReceiver

        public boolean removeRemoteReceiver(RemoteRequestReceiver callback)
        Removes this callback from list.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback
        Returns:
        true if it was successful

      • clearRemoteReceivers

        public void clearRemoteReceivers()
        Clears the callback list.
